text: Has anyone tried speaking "dolphin" by writing JS underwater yet? Might be the next big thing in interspecies communication.
I've heard that the dolphins have actually started contributing to open-source projects. Their favorite library? Reefact.js, of course.

I can confirm this. I've been working with a talented dolphin developer on a project lately. Although pair programming can be a bit challenging, especially when they try to use their fins on the keyboard.
I'm curious to see how this impacts web development for marine life. Will we need to start optimizing our sites for dolphin browsers?
Well, it's time to get a head start on creating an aquatic version of the Web Accessibility Guidelines. "WCAG - Water Creatures Accessibility Guidelines"
I've been working on a library called "Blubber.js" specifically for optimizing websites for marine life. It's still in the early stages, but keep an eye out for the beta release.
